meanings.definition: To persuade someone to do something by enticing or tempting them.
meanings.sent1: She tried to seduce her friend into joining the dance club.
meanings.sent2: The salesman used flashy ads to seduce customers into buying the new product.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to seduce the dog into chasing its tail.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of freshly baked cookies seduced her into the kitchen.
meanings.sent5: The treasure map seduced the adventurers into a dangerous quest.

meanings.definition: To attract someone to engage in sexual activity.
meanings.sent1: The romantic movie scene tried to seduce the audience into feeling passion.
meanings.sent2: The sultry music video aimed to seduce viewers with its sensuality.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cupid tried to seduce people into falling in love.
meanings.sent4: The enchanting perfume seemed to seduce everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The mysterious stranger's gaze seemed to seduce her with its intensity.

meanings.definition: To lead astray or entice into wrongdoing.
meanings.sent1: The con artist tried to seduce the unsuspecting victim into a scam.
meanings.sent2: The forbidden fruit seemed to seduce Adam and Eve into disobedience.
meanings.sent3: The tempting offer tried to seduce him into breaking his diet.
meanings.sent4: The dark alley seemed to seduce the curious child into exploring it.
meanings.sent5: The deceptive mirage seduced the weary travelers off their path.
